page.title: 22The Village Hall
page.content:
Corton Village hall was built on a footpath next to the school by Jeremiah Colman of Colman's Mustard. He was a teetotaller and wanted to deter the local workmen living in Corton from drinking after work.

The Village Hall was deliberately situated between the fields and their homes and offered teas and other non-alcoholic drinks to thirsty workmen in order to prevent them from going to the pub to spend their hard-earned money on the evil "drink!"
